speaker: First Senator
text_entry: SCENE II. A room in CORIOLANUS'S house.

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Enter CORIOLANUS with Patricians

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Let them puff all about mine ears, present me

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Death on the wheel or at wild horses' heels,

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Or pile ten hills on the Tarpeian rock,

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: That the precipitation might down stretch

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Below the beam of sight, yet will I still

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Be thus to them.

speaker: A Patrician
text_entry: You do the nobler.

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: I muse my mother

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Does not approve me further, who was wont

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: To call them woollen vassals, things created

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: To buy and sell with groats, to show bare heads

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: In congregations, to yawn, be still and wonder,

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: When one but of my ordinance stood up

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: To speak of peace or war.

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Enter VOLUMNIA

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: I talk of you:

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Why did you wish me milder? would you have me

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: False to my nature? Rather say I play

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: The man I am.

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: O, sir, sir, sir,

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: I would have had you put your power well on,

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Before you had worn it out.

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Let go.

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: You might have been enough the man you are,

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: With striving less to be so; lesser had been

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: The thwartings of your dispositions, if

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: You had not show'd them how ye were disposed

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Ere they lack'd power to cross you.

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Let them hang.

speaker: A Patrician
text_entry: Ay, and burn too.

speaker: A Patrician
text_entry: Enter MENENIUS and Senators

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Come, come, you have been too rough, something

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: too rough;

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: You must return and mend it.

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: There's no remedy;

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Unless, by not so doing, our good city

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Cleave in the midst, and perish.

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Pray, be counsell'd:

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: I have a heart as little apt as yours,

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: But yet a brain that leads my use of anger

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: To better vantage.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Well said, noble woman?

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Before he should thus stoop to the herd, but that

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: The violent fit o' the time craves it as physic

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: For the whole state, I would put mine armour on,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Which I can scarcely bear.

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: What must I do?

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Return to the tribunes.

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Well, what then? what then?

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Repent what you have spoke.

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: For them! I cannot do it to the gods;

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Must I then do't to them?

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: You are too absolute;

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Though therein you can never be too noble,

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: But when extremities speak. I have heard you say,

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Honour and policy, like unsever'd friends,

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: I' the war do grow together: grant that, and tell me,

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: In peace what each of them by the other lose,

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: That they combine not there.

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Tush, tush!

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: A good demand.

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: If it be honour in your wars to seem

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: The same you are not, which, for your best ends,

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: You adopt your policy, how is it less or worse,

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: That it shall hold companionship in peace

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: With honour, as in war, since that to both

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: It stands in like request?

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Why force you this?

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Because that now it lies you on to speak

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: To the people; not by your own instruction,

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Nor by the matter which your heart prompts you,

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: But with such words that are but rooted in

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Your tongue, though but bastards and syllables

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Of no allowance to your bosom's truth.

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Now, this no more dishonours you at all

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Than to take in a town with gentle words,

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Which else would put you to your fortune and

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: The hazard of much blood.

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: I would dissemble with my nature where

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: My fortunes and my friends at stake required

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: I should do so in honour: I am in this,

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Your wife, your son, these senators, the nobles;

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: And you will rather show our general louts

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: How you can frown than spend a fawn upon 'em,

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: For the inheritance of their loves and safeguard

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Of what that want might ruin.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Noble lady!

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Come, go with us; speak fair: you may salve so,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Not what is dangerous present, but the loss

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Of what is past.

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: I prithee now, my son,

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Go to them, with this bonnet in thy hand;

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: And thus far having stretch'd it--here be with them--

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Thy knee bussing the stones--for in such business

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Action is eloquence, and the eyes of the ignorant

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: More learned than the ears--waving thy head,

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Which often, thus, correcting thy stout heart,

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Now humble as the ripest mulberry

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: That will not hold the handling: or say to them,

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Thou art their soldier, and being bred in broils

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Hast not the soft way which, thou dost confess,

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Were fit for thee to use as they to claim,

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: In asking their good loves, but thou wilt frame

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Thyself, forsooth, hereafter theirs, so far

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: As thou hast power and person.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: This but done,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Even as she speaks, why, their hearts were yours;

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: For they have pardons, being ask'd, as free

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: As words to little purpose.

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Prithee now,

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Go, and be ruled: although I know thou hadst rather

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Follow thine enemy in a fiery gulf

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Than flatter him in a bower. Here is Cominius.

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Enter COMINIUS

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: I have been i' the market-place; and, sir,'tis fit

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: You make strong party, or defend yourself

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: By calmness or by absence: all's in anger.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Only fair speech.

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: I think 'twill serve, if he

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Can thereto frame his spirit.

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: He must, and will

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Prithee now, say you will, and go about it.

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Must I go show them my unbarbed sconce?

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Must I with base tongue give my noble heart

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: A lie that it must bear? Well, I will do't:

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Yet, were there but this single plot to lose,

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: This mould of Marcius, they to dust should grind it

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: And throw't against the wind. To the market-place!

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: You have put me now to such a part which never

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: I shall discharge to the life.

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Come, come, we'll prompt you.

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: I prithee now, sweet son, as thou hast said

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: My praises made thee first a soldier, so,

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: To have my praise for this, perform a part

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Thou hast not done before.

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Well, I must do't:

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Away, my disposition, and possess me

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Some harlot's spirit! my throat of war be turn'd,

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Which quired with my drum, into a pipe

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Small as an eunuch, or the virgin voice

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: That babies lulls asleep! the smiles of knaves

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Tent in my cheeks, and schoolboys' tears take up

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: The glasses of my sight! a beggar's tongue

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Make motion through my lips, and my arm'd knees,

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Who bow'd but in my stirrup, bend like his

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: That hath received an alms! I will not do't,

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Lest I surcease to honour mine own truth

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: And by my body's action teach my mind

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: A most inherent baseness.

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: At thy choice, then:

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: To beg of thee, it is my more dishonour

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Than thou of them. Come all to ruin; let

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Thy mother rather feel thy pride than fear

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Thy dangerous stoutness, for I mock at death

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: With as big heart as thou. Do as thou list

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Thy valiantness was mine, thou suck'dst it from me,

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: But owe thy pride thyself.

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Pray, be content:

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Mother, I am going to the market-place;

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Chide me no more. I'll mountebank their loves,

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Cog their hearts from them, and come home beloved

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Of all the trades in Rome. Look, I am going:

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Commend me to my wife. I'll return consul;

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Or never trust to what my tongue can do

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: I' the way of flattery further.

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Do your will.

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Exit

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Away! the tribunes do attend you: arm yourself

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: To answer mildly; for they are prepared

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: With accusations, as I hear, more strong

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Than are upon you yet.

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: The word is 'mildly.' Pray you, let us go:

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Let them accuse me by invention, I

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Will answer in mine honour.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Ay, but mildly.

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Well, mildly be it then. Mildly!

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Exeunt
